result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke W Aitken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:17 a.m. 
**Includes 15CF311 & 15CF346**
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Dana Norgard. Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing in both files. Attorney Norgard wishes to proceed with Plea today as well. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed in both cases.  Readings Waived. Parties proceed with Plea Hearing. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State moves to: 15CF311- DRI Ct.2- Retail Theft & 15CF346- DRI Ct.1- Bail Jumping (Felony)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 15CF311- Ct.1- Bail Jumping (Felony)>>GUILTY
           15CF346- Ct.2- Retail Theft- Intentionally Take>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CF311- Ct.1- 2 years Wisconsin State Prison System, 1 year IC & 1 year ES concurrrent to 15CF346 & any other sentence currently serving. CONDITIONS: Participate in any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both, absolute sobriety, pay restitution in the amount of $469.00 to Walmart, CC & DNA surcharge. Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP. 
15CF346- Ct.2- 9 months MCJ concurrent to 15CF311 and any other sentence currently serving, pay restitution in the amount of $244.87 to Sam's Club, CC & DNA surcharge.
Adj: 9:27 a.m.
Waiver of Prelim on May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

**Includes 14CF717, 14CF840, 14CF841, 14CF972, 14CF973, 14CF1025, 14CM1501, 14CM1502, 15CF244 & 15CF311. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Dana Norgard. Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing on 14CF840, 14CF841, 14CF972, 14CF973, 14CF1025 & 15CF244.

Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.

Attorney Norgard states parties are ready to proceed with Plea/Sentencing Hearing on all cases except 15CF311. Initial Appearance in 15CF311 held and separate minute sheet prepared. CC on April 7th, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. in Br.2 office to set Preliminary Hearing. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights and Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF717 Ct.2, 14CF840 Ct.1, 14CF841 Ct.1, 14CF973 Ct.1, 14CF1025 Ct.1, 15CF244 Ct.1 & Ct.2- 3 1/2 years WI State Prison System-1 year IC, 2 1/2 years ES concurrent to each other and all other jail/prison sentences currently serving. CONDITIONS of ES: Participate in any assessment, counseling and treatment as deemed appropriate by agent, AODA and follow up, absolute sobriety, GFE obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both, DNA sample and surcharge, CC.
14CF972- Ct.2 & 15CF244 Ct.11 & Ct.12- 9 months MCJ concurrent to each other and all other jail/prison sentences currently serving.  
Defendant is entitled to 18 days credit in 15CF244 and 23 days credit on 14CF717, 14CF840, 14CF841, 14CF972, 14CF973 & 14CF1025.  
Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP. Defendant is remanded to MCSD for transport to WI State Prison System. 
Adj: 2:42 p.m.
CLERK AMENDS MINUTES 04/06/15
